page.title: 18Local Walks 2
page.content: TRUNDLE TO SINGLETON CHURCH Starting just north of the Trundle one goes down a small lane and onto a footpath.This leads through a field in which wheat is grown,then the field thins out and there is a stile.Then,a track leads down past a line of trees and the view all around is good-many things are visible,such as chalk pits in the side of the downs ,and the church at the bottom of the hill.As one approaches the church one is confronted by a large slope which leads to the rear entrance to the church.
